definition: to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.english: PSF: You prefer doing your work on your own in your studio?
sentences.chinese: 你喜歡自己一個人在錄音棚裏搗鼓嗎？

sentences.english: I have tried not to become too conscious of why exactly I came up with it.
sentences.chinese: 我已經試着讓自己不要太在意搗鼓出這個書名的原因。

sentences.english: Working together with one or more people to put together a killer presentation?
sentences.chinese: 想要和幾個哥們一起搗鼓出一個殺手級的演示文稿？

sentences.english: He fiddled about for few minutes, said the drain was okay and disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 他在浴室搗鼓了幾分鐘後說了聲“好了”就走了。

sentences.english: Encourage your wealthy neighbors to buy new Cadillacs.
sentences.chinese: 搗鼓你的富鄰居們買新的卡迪拉克。

sentences.english: I won't fly in that piece of reverse-engineered piece of rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 我決不會坐那個通過逆向工程搗鼓出來的垃圾飛機。
